Data Exploration

This section documents functions related to data exploration.

Summarize Special Characters

summarize_special_characters.summarize_special_characters(dataframe: DataFrame) → DataFrame

Summarizes the count of special characters in each column of a pandas DataFrame.

This function iterates through each column and row of the input DataFrame, searching for any character that is not alphanumeric (i.e., not a-z, A-Z, or 0-9). It counts the occurrences of each special character and returns a summary as a pandas DataFrame, with columns representing the original columns and rows for each special character found.

Parameters

dataframe (pandas.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to analyze.

Returns

A DataFrame summarizing the counts of special characters found in each column of the input DataFrame. The DataFrame has a ‘Column’ column for the column names and additional columns for each special character identified, showing the count of occurrences in the respective column.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Examples

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> data = {
...     'name': ['Alice', 'Bob*', 'Charlie#'],
...     'address': ['123 Main St.', '456 Elm St.@', '789 Pine St.']
... }
>>> df = pd.DataFrame(data)
>>> summary_df = summarize_special_characters(df)
>>> print(summary_df)
    Column  *  #  .  @
0      name  1  1  0  0
1   address  0  0  3  1

Note

This function uses regular expressions to identify special characters and requires the re module. The pandas library is used for both input and output, so ensure these libraries are installed and imported.

Create Line Chart Subplots

create_line_chart_subplots.create_line_chart_subplots(df: DataFrame, title: str = 'Process Report - Features', subplot_num_columns: int = 6, subplot_title_font_size: int = 11) → Figure

Creates a series of line chart subplots for each column in a pandas DataFrame.

Each column in the DataFrame is plotted as a separate line chart in a subplot. The function dynamically calculates the necessary number of rows based on the number of columns in the DataFrame and the specified number of subplot columns.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the data to plot. Each column is plotted as a separate line chart.

  • title (str) – The title of the entire figure.

  • subplot_num_columns (int) – The number of subplot columns. Determines how many subplots are displayed in each row.

  • subplot_title_font_size (int) – The font size for the titles of each subplot.

Returns

A Plotly figure object containing the line chart subplots.

Return type

go.Figure

Example Usage:

import pandas as pd
# Sample DataFrame creation
df = pd.DataFrame({
    'A': range(1, 6),
    'B': range(10, 15),
    'C': range(20, 25),
})
fig = create_line_chart_subplots(df, 'Sample Title', 3, 10)
fig.show()

Note

The function requires the Plotly library for plotting.
